intro: Crepis barbata, commonly known as the hairy thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along streambanks, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are yellow and bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
